intro: Leucas bukobensis, commonly known as Bukoban leucas, is a flowering plant native to East Africa, particularly Tanzania. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open woodland and grassland habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, hairy seeds. Leucas bukobensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native environment.
